conclusion: Analyze the image to understand the flow path of the liquid through the baffles.
Identify the connections between the containers and the baffles.
Determine which container (E or F) the liquid will flow into.
The image shows a series of containers labeled A, B, C, D, E, and F.
There are arrows indicating the flow of liquid through baffles.
Containers A, B, C, and D are connected to baffles, which then lead to containers E and F.
The liquid flows out from containers A, B, C, and D.
The liquid passes through baffles, which are represented by the arrows.
The arrows from A, B, C, and D point towards the baffles.
The baffles then lead to containers E and F.
The arrows from the baffles point towards container F.
Therefore, the liquid will flow into container F after passing through the baffles.
